abstract_summ: Unlike gene expression methods that capture aging-specific information but study genes in isolation, or protein-protein interaction (PPI) network methods that account for PPIs but the PPIs are context-unspecific, we recently integrated the two data types into an aging-specific PPI subnetwork, which yielded more accurate aging-related gene predictions.We describe a framework for predicting phenotype values by utilizing gene expression data transformed into sample-specific topological signatures by employing feature subsampling and persistent homology.Our previously described pipeline 1 was utilized to extract hu-man genes from the pathway figure images.We then explore expression levels of the gene network across tissues and cell types in the brain, as well as across 34 schizophrenia versus control differential gene expression datasets.This study confirms that gene expression can be a useful indicator of the presence or absence of a condition, and the subtle signal contained in this high dimensional data reveals itself when considering the intricate topological connections between expressed genes.
title_summ: Cancer neoantigen prioritization through sensitive and reliable proteogenomics analysisIntegrative computational epigenomics to build data-driven gene regulation hypothesesA Topological Data Analysis Approach on Predicting Phenotypes from Gene Expression DataMulti-omics Data and Analytics Integration in Ovarian CancerTree Based Advanced Relative Expression AnalysisAnalysis of Ensemble Feature Selection for Correlated High-Dimensional RNA-Seq Cancer DataMMRF-CoMMpass Data Integration and Analysis for Identifying Prognostic MarkersInferring Candidate CircRNA-Disease Associations by Bi-random Walk Based on CircRNA Regulatory SimilarityKaleidoscope: A New Bioinformatics Pipeline Web Application for In Silico Hypothesis Exploration of Omics SignaturesOmics BioAnalytics: Reproducible Research using R Shiny and AlexaFinding disease modules for cancer and COVID-19 in gene co-expression networks with the Core&Peel method25 Years of Pathway FiguresImproving supervised prediction of aging-related genes via dynamic network analysisOverview: Data Generation Techniques:From Omics to Personalized Approaches and Clinical Care
title_abstract_phrases: Unlike gene expression methods that capture aging-specific information but study genes in isolation, or protein-protein interaction (PPI) network methods that account for PPIs but the PPIs are context-unspecific, we recently integrated the two data types into an aging-specific PPI subnetwork, which yielded more accurate aging-related gene predictions.This study confirms that gene expression can be a useful indicator of the presence or absence of a condition, and the subtle signal contained in this high dimensional data reveals itself when considering the intricate topological connections between expressed genes.We describe a framework for predicting phenotype values by utilizing gene expression data transformed into sample-specific topological signatures by employing feature subsampling and persistent homology.We then explore expression levels of the gene network across tissues and cell types in the brain, as well as across 34 schizophrenia versus control differential gene expression datasets.Tree Based Advanced Relative Expression AnalysisThis paper presents a new concept for biomarker discovery and gene expression data classification that rises from the Relative Expression Analysis (RXA).
